title: Christina Aguilera vows to 'never feel helpless to a man'
text:
Christina Aguilera has always lived her life ‘fearlessly’ (Picture: JB Lacroix/WireImage)

Christina Aguilera has vowed she will never let men walk all over her and honestly, is there a better goal in life?

In a new interview with The Sunday Times, the 38-year-old singer revealed the ‘male-run’ music industry is full of ‘wolves’.

The Genie in a Bottle singer explained: ‘It was a business with so many wolves – older men who had other intentions.’

She added: ‘When you’re that young coming up in a male-run business, you’re going to see the darkest sides of things and hear how men talk about women, how they talked about my breasts.

‘I do look back at that younger me, who needed a hug, and I want to tell her that not all men are like this.’

‘When people just accept it and say, “Oh well, you know, boys will be boys”, I disagree. Because I do feel men should be held accountable,’ she added.

Christina Aguilera has vowed to ‘never feel helpless to a man’ (Picture: Gregg DeGuire/Getty Images)

Christina then revealed how she’s grown since her first record, Genie, dropped.

She said she felt comfortable expressing her sexuality, even though she got ‘heat’ for ‘reinventing the chaps look.’

The Beautiful singer revealed: ‘I was interested in opening up that conversation at the time, comfortable in my own skin, sharing that sexuality and part of myself.

‘Women are not just one-dimensional creatures who should only view our sexuality from a man’s point of view,’ she added.

Reflecting on her attitude to empowerment, Christina said she’s never shied away from speaking her mind.

‘If you look back at my body of work and the decisions I made, you’ll see it’s been very progressive,’ she said. ‘Fearlessness is something that I always wanted, because I saw my mother in so many positions where she was weak and so very dominated.

‘That was one of my decisions, as a woman, that I would never feel helpless to a man,’ she said.
